---
title: "Markov chains and Metropolis--Hastings"
---


## Content

- Rejection sampling
- Basics of Markov chains
- Metropolis--Hastings algorithm


## Learning objectives

At the end of the chapter, students should be able to

- understand how ordinary Monte Carlo and Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods differ
- implement a MHG algorithm to draw samples from the posterior
- use output of MCMC to obtain estimates and standard errors
- use efficient proposals and tuning for MCMC

## Readings


- [@Geyer:2011](https://www.mcmchandbook.net/HandbookChapter1.pdf) --- up to 1.17
- [Chapters 4](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH80601A/markovchains.html) [and 5](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH80601A/mcmc.html) of the course notes


## Complementary readings

- @Green:2015 (overview of MCMC methods)
- @Neal:2003 (slice sampling)
